title: Ed Woodward rejects Man Utd fans' claims about the Glazers' focus at Old Trafford

Manchester United chief Ed Woodward has rejected claims that money is more important than on-field success at Old Trafford.

United's executive vice-chairman is a man under fire after the club’s dismal start to the season.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s men are 12th in the Premier League, just two points above the drop zone, after their worst start to a campaign in 30 years.

They head into Sunday’s meeting with Liverpool 15 points behind Jurgen Klopp’s league leaders - despite having spent £900million on players since Sir Alex Ferguson’s exit in 2013.

United continue to post mega-money revenues however, and continue to boast a plethora of commercial partners.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

When United announce annual revenues of £627.1million last month investors had the chance to grill Woodward on the club’s disappointing on-field performances - and chose not to.

A large group of supporters believe Woodward is little more than a yes man for the club’s owners, the Glazer family, and that the Americans are only interested in profits and what they can take out of the club.

But Woodward has again insisted that is not the case, and that the football side remains the priority.

(Image: Reuters)

“The reality of Manchester United is we are a club in two parts,” said Woodward.

“First of all, we are an incredible 141-year footballing institution with all that history, all that legacy, all that tradition and that tradition of success.

“That can never, ever change. We need to keep that protected.

“Then, like other football clubs, our commercial business allows us to reinvest in the football side.

“It's how these two interact with each other at Manchester United that results in us having a competitive advantage in this area.

“What's important is the commercial side is never allowed to take priority over the football side.”
description: As Manchester United's performances on the field continue to disappoint, profits and revenues continue to soar off it
